text: Agnidra discispilaria is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Moore in 1867. It is found in north-eastern India, Sikkim and Thailand. The wingspan is 19–23 mm for males and 21.5-22.5 mm for females.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Suppl. 12 The wings are dull pale sienna reddish, crossed by numerous ill-defined irregular greyish-brown lines. The external border and angle of the forewings is clouded with the same colour. All wings have a dark rounded slate-grey spot at the inferior angle of the discoidal cell. There are some greenish-white scales in each of these spots.Illustrations of Typical Specimens of Lepidoptera Heterocera in the Collection of the British Museum 6 : 17 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1867 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Asia
title: Agnidra discispilaria
